You see a sign in the distance which says 'Now Leaving {region[local][name]}'.

Do you keep going or do you stay in {region[local][name]}?
result_s:
You march triumphantly past the sign and onward towards the horizon.

(You are now in {gen[opens][0][name]})

event_s:
You find a mysterious, {spec[0][full_name]} on the ground.

It radiates an indescribably powerful energy.

Strangely, you can almost feel it calling to you.
result_s:
You reach out your hand to pick it up, but you collapse, overwhelmed by its energy.

You wake up hours later and the {spec[0][full_name]} is gone.

You grit your teeth and manage to place a hand around the {spec[0][full_name]}'s handle.

Its aura intensifies, but you somehow feel that it has accepted you as its owner.

({spec[0][full_name]} is now in your inventory)

You leave it alone.

Some things were not meant for mortal men to meddle in.

You turn around to try walk away, but the call of the {spec[0][full_name]} is too strong.

Before you know it, you've grabbed a hold of it and placed it in your inventory.


({spec[0][full_name]} is now in your inventory)

event_s:
You come across a rock with a large, Shovel-shaped hole in the top.

Above the rock there is a plaque inscribed with the words:

'Only the chosen may gain passage'
result_s:
You're not sure you have what it takes.

You leave the stone alone and continue on your way.

You place your Shovel inside the hole, but nothing happens.

After waiting a couple of minutes you take your Shovel and leave, dissatisfied.

You place your Legendary Shovel inside the hole and it suddenly closes up!

You hear a whirring sound which then stops after a few seconds. Suddenly, you feel a burst of energy flow through you, which seems to come from the rock itself.

You leave, feeling more powerful than ever.

event_s:
As you're walking along a path a man clad in shady clothing bursts from the bushes.

'Hey, you! Can you hold onto something for me? I'll come back and get it later, and I'll pay you for your trouble?'
result_s:
'What?'

The man says, shocked.

'Well, what are you gunna do?'

He dives back into the bushes, unfazed by your refusal to help.

You continue on your way.

You take the item, which suspiciously looks like {spec[0][full_name]}. The man thanks you and jumps back into the bushes.

You continue on your way with the {spec[0][full_name]} in hand.

({spec[0][full_name]} is now in your inventory)

speech_shifty: 'Hey, you! Can you hold onto something for me? I'll come back and get it later, and I'll pay you for your trouble?'

event_s:
You're walking along the path when a man clad in armour typical of a guard interrupts you.

'Have you seen a suspicious man along here recently? He is wanted for stealing some Stolen Maple syrup in {gen[towns][0][name]}.'
action_s: You mean this Stolen Maple syrup?
result_s:
'Shame', he sighs.

He leaves and you continue on your way.

'Thank you very much, citizen,' he thanks you and starts running in the direction you gave him.

You continue on your way.

'Thief!', the guard exclaims.

He places you under arrest and takes you to {gen[towns][0][name]} for questioning, also confiscating the Stolen Maple syrup.

However, after determining that you were not the thief, he reluctantly releases you.

You decide to look around the town while you're there.

speech_normal: 'Have you seen a suspicious man along here recently? He is wanted for stealing some Stolen Maple syrup in {gen[towns][0][name]}.'
'Shame'
'Thank you very much, citizen,'
'Thief!'

event_s:
'Hey, you!'

A shadily clothed man jumps out from the bushes next to you.

He seems familiar.

'Do you have the stuff? The thing I gave you for safekeeping?'
result_s:
'Alright, be like that,' he says, diving back into the bushes.

You probably won't see him for a while.

'Damn, that sucks,' he sighs.

'Not much I can do about that, but I can't pay you now,' he shrugs, then dives back into the bushes.

You feel disappointed that you won't get paid, but continue on your way nonetheless.

'That's it! Here, take this, as thanks.'

He hands you a {gen[items][0][full_name]} and dives back into the bushes with his Stolen Maple syrup.

You continue on your way, satisfied with a job well done.

You've always been passionate about learning, so heading to the {region[local][school][name]} would be enjoyable.

Just kidding. You might be able to learn some sick kung-fu skills if you go though, so why not.

'My name is Father {region[local][occupants][1][name]}. How can I help you today?'
result_s: You leave the church. You can always visit later.

You hand over your tithe and the priest pulls you into a private room.

After performing a healing ceremony, you feel much better.

The priest obliges and blesses you, protecting against all manner of hexes.

Whether it will work or not still remains to be seen.

The priest obliges and blesses you with good fortune.

It won't let you win the lottery, but maybe you'll find some spare change on the street or something.

As you splash around like a two-year-old in the church's holy water the priest can only stare in shock.

Eventually the city guards come and pull you out. They seem to be disappointed more than angry.

You decide to stay out of the church for now.

That was a waste of time.

He looks depressed, so you think you'd better leave him alone for now.

You leave the school.

You try to train yourself despite the lack of a teacher.

It doesn't work very well.

You give up after 20 minutes and decide to go do something else outside of the school.

It works somewhat ok, but you don't make much progress because you're too stupid.

event_s:
You come across a fork in the road, accompanied by a wooden signpost.

To the east is the town {gen[towns][0][name]}. To the west is the town {gen[towns][1][name]}.

Which direction do you want to go?
result_s: You start walking back where you came. You hate towns.
You start walking east. Hopefully you'll find something interesting in {gen[towns][0][name]}.
You start walking west. Maybe something fun will happen in {gen[towns][1][name]}.

event_s:
While you're walking, a glint in the distance attracts your attention.

As you get closer, you notice that it looks like a {gen[items][0][full_name]}. You wonder why it's here, of all places.
result_s:
You decide to leave it where it is.

Maybe someone is coming back to get it or something.
You decide to leave it alone. It might be booby-trapped.
You're not sure why it's here, but you decide not to find out. You continue on your way.

You pick the {gen[items][0][full_name]} up. Nothing happens. You leave with it in your hands, a smug grin on your face.

({gen[items][0][full_name]} is now in your inventory)

You pick the {gen[items][0][full_name]} up.

Almost instantly, a bolt of lightning strikes the place where it was placed, knocking you back and searing the ground around you.

'Leave the {gen[items][0][full_name]} where you found it, mortal', a powerful, disembodied voice bellows.

You drop the {gen[items][0][full_name]} and start running. It would be best to not mess with it for now.

You kick the {gen[items][0][full_name]}. Nothing happens.

You're not sure why you did that.

As you're considering the possible strategies you could use to seduce the {gen[items][0][full_name]}, it suddenly dawns on you that it might not be possible.

You decide to give up for now and exercise your sexual allure on other, more conscious beings.

You attempt to persuade the {gen[items][0][full_name]} to sleep with you, but it seems to be impervious to your charms.

You might need more practice.

You decide to leave for now and return when you are more skilled in the art of seduction.

speech_godlike: 'Leave the {gen[items][0][full_name]} where you found it, mortal'

event_s:
You see an old man who appears to be trying to cross the road.

There's nothing in his way, but he seems to be visibly struggling.
result_s: You leave. He'll be fine.

You decide to help him cross the road.

As you lead him across, he starts telling you about how he's going to visit his grandson {gen[towns][0][shop][owner][name]} in {gen[towns][0][name]}. You don't care that much, but he seems nice.

When you're on the other side, he thanks you and you both go your separate ways.

You sprint up to the old man and shove him over with the full extent of your strength.

He flies backwards and crumples, motionless, by the side of the road.

You're not sure what you were expecting.

You sprint up to the old man and try to shove him over, only to bounce off him as if he was a brick wall.

'Big mistake,' he growls.

You start running in the opposite direction.

Any old man who speaks in purple colored text is not worth messing with.

event_s:
You feel guilty about the old man you just knocked over, so you go back to help him up.

Surprisingly, he seems fine, and doesn't appear to be seriously injured.

While he is a bit annoyed that he was pushed over, he has forgotten that it was you who did it.
result_s:
You decide to leave him alone now that you've atoned for your previous guilt.

You've done all you needed to do.

You still feel a bit guilty, so you help him cross the road.

He's still a bit gruntled once you're both on the other side, but it looks like he'll be able to make it wherever he's going.

You decide to continue on your way.

'I'll forgive you for the first time, but I wouldn't try it again if I were you,' the old man asserts, almost as if had just read your mind.

He is exuding a terrifying aura that wasn't there a second ago.

Panicked, you slowly back away, and then start running in the opposite direction as fast as you can.

speech_sinister: 'I'll forgive you for the first time, but I wouldn't try it again if I were you,'

event_s:
Well, you died.

Fortunately for you, there is an afterlife, and it's quite supportive of people who are idiots.

Maybe you can keep living after all.
result_s:
You decide to reincarnate.

You're not quite sure how to do it, so you decide to just think about it really hard. Suddenly, a bright light appears in front of you.

You start moving towards it, until eventually you can't feel anything anymore.

(You wake up back in reality, and continue on your way)

event_s: You see a figure in the distance. They wave at you.
result_s:
You turn your back to them and walk away.

Ice cold.
You enthusiastically wave back at them.

event_s: The person in the distance waves back at you.
result_s:
You turn your back to them and walk away.

Ice cold.
You wave back another time. You've really outdone yourself this time.

event_s: As you are about to continue exploring, the person in the distance waves another time.
result_s:
You turn your back to them and walk away.

Ice cold.
You wave back yet again.

event_s: The person in the distance waves yet again. This is starting to get ridiculous.
result_s:
You turn your back to them and walk away.

Ice cold.

The instant you raise your hand to wave back, a wall of water crashes on top of you, knocking you to the ground.

The pun isn't lost on you as you sit on the ground, coughing up water.

event_s:
'I am a Microwave'

You look to the side.

There is a strange metal box with an opaque side. It has an unusual, black cord leading out of it.

'I am a Microwave,' it states politely.
result_s: You leave. This is too surreal to deal with right now.

'I am a Microwave,' it states yet again.

You decide to let it be a Microwave on its own.

It doesn't respond, seemingly confused.

'I am a Microwave,' it states yet again.

You decide to let it be a Microwave on its own.

You pick it up.

'I am a Microwave,' it exclaims while you place it in your inventory.

(Microwave is now in your inventory)

event_s:
As you walk absentmindedly, you eventually find yourself in a clearing in a forest.

Strangely enough, there is a table in the centre with a single, six-sided Die placed on top.

As you look around, you don't notice anyone else there.
result_s:
You walk past the table and Die and out of the clearing, back into the forest.

You don't really care for Die games anyway.

You roll a 1.

Nothing happens.

You decide to leave seeing as there's nothing interesting here.

You roll a 2.

You hear some giggling in the bushes behind you.

You decide to leave because you're getting creeped out.

You roll a 3.

Suddenly, an intense bout of laughter sounds from the bushes behind you.

You panic and start running in the opposite direction.

You roll a 4.

You hear rustling in the bushes behind you.

When you turn around, you see a monstrous face in the bushes.

It smiles at you.

You decide to start running in the opposite direction, because that's creepy as hell and you don't want anything to do with it.

You roll a 5.

You hear something in the bushes behind you, and turn around to investigate.

When you find nothing, you come back to the table to see that there are 5 gold coins that weren't there before.

You take them and leave, weirded out by the whole scenario.

You roll a 6.

You hear some rustling behind you from the bushes.

When you turn around, there is a {gen[items][0][full_name]} on the ground along with some gold coins.

You decide to take them and walk off into the forest, confused but satisfied with the profit you made.

You accidentally roll too hard and the Die falls off the table.

After spending some time looking for it, you realise it's gone. What a shame.

You decide to leave seeing as there is nothing to do anymore.

In a stunning fit of rage, you yell angrily and flip the table over, sending the Die flying.

You hear a gasp from the bushes and, shortly after, the crunch of twigs and leaves underfoot as something sprints away from you.

You leave the clearing, content with the masterful table flip you just performed.

'No you don't,' you hear a voice shout back.

Odd, but it seems they don't want you to know they're there.

Humouring them, you leave the clearing, pretending to be wholly unaware of their presence.

'Oh maaaaan,' a voice cries out in disappointment.

A small monster crawls out from the bushes. It looks like it's an adolescent.

'You got me. Here.'

It hands you some gold and a {gen[items][0][full_name]}.

You accept them, stunned, before leaving the clearing.

event_s:
'HEY'

You turn around, but can't see where the voice is coming from.

'DOWN HERE'

You look down and see a pile of rocks. One of them is redder than the others and seems to be the source of the yelling.

'PUT ME BACK ON THE TOP OF THE PILE,' it yells.
result_s:
'DON'T YOU DARE LEAVE ME,' it screams, as you start walking away.

What an insufferable rock.

'HEY. DON'T DO THAT.'

You pick up the rock and wind your arm back.

'YOU PRICK. PUT ME DOWN, ASSHOLE.'

The shouting fades away into nothingness as you launch it into the horizon with the precision and power of an olympic athlete. Happy with the result, you continue on your way.

'NICE,' the rock exclaims.

'THIS IS VERY GOOD.'

You leave, but you are still slightly irritated that you never got a single 'Thank you'.

speech_annoying: 'HEY'
'DOWN HERE'
'PUT ME BACK ON THE TOP OF THE PILE,'
'DON'T YOU DARE LEAVE ME,'
'HEY. DON'T DO THAT.'
'YOU PRICK. PUT ME DOWN, ASSHOLE.'
'NICE,'
'THIS IS VERY GOOD.'

event_s:
You meet someone walking the opposite direction, as they appear to be searching for something.

'Hi, my name is {gen[characters][0][name]}. I'm an archeologist. I hate Scarabs, and I was wondering if you had a spare Shovel on hand. Could you help me out?'
result_s:
'Oh, no worries then,' {gen[characters][0][name]} shrugs.

Seeing as you cannot help them, you both agree to go your separate ways.
'That's it! Thank you so much!' {gen[characters][0][name]} thanks you ecstaticly.

The color drains from {gen[characters][0][name]}'s face.

'AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA'

'GET IT AWAY FROM ME'

{gen[characters][0][name]} runs away from the Scarab while screaming. You find this hilarious.

speech_normal: 'Hi, my name is {gen[characters][0][name]}. I'm an archeologist. I hate scarabs, and I was wondering if you had a spare shovel on hand. Could you help me out?'
'Oh, no worries then,'
'That's it! Thank you so much!'
'AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA'
'GET IT AWAY FROM ME'

event_s:
The bot creator, Reuben, has run out of ideas for events and is now inserting meta events in random places.

What do you say to make him stop?
action_s: This is worse than no event at all
result_s:
Reuben realises his lack of imagination is holding him back and seeks assistance.

As you continue on your way, you feel a strange desire to drop event ideas in the comments.

Reuben is utterly convinced by your sound, rational argumentation.

He decides to make more effort when writing events from now on.

You walk onwards, satisfied with this result.

Reuben is so disgusted with his own meta-narrative that he vows to make better events from now on.

Feeling satisfied that you manipulated him into making better events, you continue forward.

No, you.

(You have now been roasted by Reuben)

event_s:
As you're walking along, you notice a tall, imposing structure in the distance. It seems to be behind a forest.

After a few hours of walking towards the structure, you find that it is in fact a large oak tree. Even more curious is the fact that a spiral staircase is located inside of it.

The tree stretches so high into the sky that you could almost lose your balance looking straight up at the branches.
result_s:
This doesn't seem safe. What if there are no safety rails at the top? You could fall.

You decide to not chance it and instead stay on solid ground. You continue on your way.

Why not? This seems too interesting to pass up.

You make your way into the oak-encased spiral staircase and proceed upwards.

event_s:
You've been climbing the staircase for a while now.

While you aren't sure of exactly how long, you do know you are exhausted.

You pause and sit down on one of the steps to take a short break.
result_s:
Time waits for no man. You get up and resume the climb.

Besides, if you turn back now, then that's just more time wasted.

event_s:
After ascending even more steps, you finally find yourself in an open room.

It's large, but has a bed, sink, some flower pots and additional furnishings. There is a woman seated to the side in front of a set of bookcases. She is reading something you can't quite make out, but it's quite a large book?

'Welcome,' she greets you, smiling.
result_s:
You ignore the woman, and quickly continue to the other side of the room where the staircase begins again.

She smiles kindly despite your brazen snubness, and calmly goes back to her reading her book.

She beckons to you, folding over a page corner in her book and placing it back into the bookshelf.

You sit down in the chair opposite her.

You freeze, obviously shocked at the fact that there is a person supposedly living inside a giant tree.

You turn around, panicked, and start hurriedly making your way down the stairs. How incredibly mortifying.

A large amount of stairs later and you find yourself at ground level again. Maybe you'll come back again when you're a tad less socially anxious.

speech_normal: 'Welcome,'

event_s:
'My name is Hannah,' she begins.

'To cut a long story short, I live here to take care of the tree.' She smirks, amicably.

'You might not be satisfied with that answer, so if you have more questions, feel free to ask them. I'll answer any that you may have.'
action_s: Why do you take care of it?
result_s:
She looks around the room, gazing at the wooden walls and windows and floors.

'You know, I'm not entirely sure myself.'

'I do know that it's something very wonderful, beautiful, but apart from what I can see with my own eyes I couldn't tell you a thing.'

It's not very a very helpful answer, but her love for the tree appears genuine. It's also somewhat creepy.

'This? It's just some light reading. When you live in a tree there isn't much apart from reading that you can use to pass the time.'

You agree. It must be incredibly boring to sit up here all the time.

'This tree,' she begins, 'grows a very special fruit. It's not something of this earth.'

'I'm sure once you try it, you'll understand what I mean.'

How cryptic. Why is it that mysterious women in surreal, otherworldly scenarios always end up being so frustratingly vague?

'I'm not sure what that is, but it does sound like something I'd enjoy,' she surmises.

You feel cheated, because she didn't get the meme.

'Then I suppose you're going to continue onwards,' she states, getting up from her chair and moving to the sink.

'If you need me for anything, just come back down the stairs and I'll help you out as best I can.'

event_s:
A bright light shines through an opening in the roof.

You rush upwards with the last ounce of stamina you've conserved along the journey, to find a small canopy of trees. One in particular is laden with a fruit that shines brilliantly. Upon further inspection, you find that they are in fact Golden oranges.

You're not quite sure what else is different from regular Oranges, but you might as well take one, right?
result_s:
You pick off a Golden orange and put it in your inventory.

This will make a good snack in the future, you suppose.

After resting at the top of the tree for a time, you make your way back to ground level and continue on your way, pleased with the loot you've obtained and the adventure you completed.

You're not really sure what this Golden orange is, so it might be better to leave it alone for now.

You can always come back later, overlooking the work it took to get up to the top of the damn tree in the first place.

You quickly make your way back to solid ground and continue on your way, slightly dissatisfied with the lack of something to show for all that effort.

event_s:
You stop for a break, seeing as you haven't had one for a while.

You consider the Golden orange that you obtained a while ago from that massive oak tree, and how it might taste. You could also take a nap and save the Golden orange for later.
result_s:
You peel the Golden orange and take a bit.

It's thoroughly delicious, but for some reason,

you feel.. sleepy...

You decide to take a nap instead.

Golden oranges must stay fresh for a while anyway, so you'll try it later.

event_s:
You wake up lying down in an unknown place.

You sit up and immediately notice the intensely surrealistic nature of your surroundings. The sky is a light shade of pink, the grass is a deep blue, and you're encircled by orchards of fruit trees as well as purple sheep.

You feel curiously drawn to the orchards, but you feel as if you should take some time to investigate the rest of this peculiar dimension first.
result_s: You decide that the orchards are where you want to go anyway, so you head off to see what types of fruits are growing.

You decide that the sheep are quite cute, and walk up to them to see if they are okay with you petting them.

Surprisingly, they seem comfortable around you and even start nudging your side to attract more attention. Their wool is unexpectedly coarse, but much softer than you had first imagined.

It must be slightly different to actual sheep wool, given the purple quality.

You lie back down and place your hands behind your head.

For about an hour, you simply gaze at the clouds, as they hang in the unfamiliar pink ceiling. The sky is constantly moving, as the thin, wispy clouds float across the atmosphere.

You find this incredibly relaxing, almost therapeutic.

You decide the best way to make use of this new environment is to sleep in it. An interesting decision.

You wake up a few hours later, feeling particularly well-rested.

You feel a little less fatigued and more able to investigate the rest of this eerily relaxing world.

Most of them possess fruits that you can't recognise, let alone describe. All of them are Golden, and have a strangely delicate quality. A few familiar fruits make themselves apparent.

You're tall enough to reach, so you could pick one of them, if you wanted to.

You decide to pick the Golden orange. A classic choice.

As soon as you pluck it off the branch, you feel a familiar feeling wash over you.

You feel.. sleepy... again....

You decide to pick the Golden apple. Just as good a choice as any.

As soon as you pluck it off the branch, you feel a familiar feeling wash over you.

You feel.. sleepy... again....

You are enjoying the orchards, but also want to check out what you may have missed elsewhere.

You decide to head back to where you woke up to see what else you can do.

You wake back up to a regular blue sky, lying down on regular green grass. How boring.

You're also clutching that {char[inventory][0][full_name]} in your hands, which is strange enough.

You're not quite sure how to explain what just happened, but you have a few guesses.
action_s: It was just a prank, bro

event_s:
You meet a strange man while travelling through the {region[local][name]}.

He introduces himself as Lewis, and explains that he is a travelling merchant, with many interesting wares for sale.

He takes some of his goods out of his wagon and puts them on display, asking if you would be interested in purchasing one of them.
result_s:
You tell Lewis you're not interested in purchasing any of these items.

Obviously discouraged, he apologises for wasting your time and loads his goods back into his wagon. You both go your separate ways.

You ask if you can purchase the Old Teapot.

Lewis compliments your choice, explaining that the teapot is of the 'highest quality'.

(Old Teapot is now in your inventory)

You ask Lewis if the Old Pocketwatch is for sale.

He says it is, and offers it to you at a cost of 1 gold. As you exchange goods, he adds that it belonged to an old friend of his.

(Old Pocketwatch is now in your inventory)

You tell Lewis that you are interested in the Vorpal Blade.

For a brief moment, he seems alarmed, but assures you that it is, indeed, for sale. As he hands it over, he warns you to be careful.

You're not sure what he means by that.

(Vorpal Blade is now in your inventory)

event_s:
As you're wandering around {region[local][name]}, some children playing in the street wander near. One of them is wearing a ragged top-hat, and waltzes up to you.

'Have you seen my teapot?' they ask you.
result_s:
'Oh, okay.' the child replies, despondent.

They walk back to their friends, obviously bereaved that you do not know where their teapot is.

speech_normal: 'Have you seen my teapot?'
'Oh, okay.'

event_s:
As you're wandering around {region[local][name]}, some children playing in the street wander near. One of them is wearing a ragged top-hat, and waltzes up to you.

'That's my Old Teapot!' they proudly announce.

'I'm so happy you found it!'
result_s:
You're not sure why, but you feel like they need it more than you do.

They happily accept your generosity and skip back over to their friends, clinging to your Old Teapot.

'Why, it has to be my Old Teapot,' the child explains.

'I'm the Mad Hatter, so it must belong to me!'

event_s:
You decide to take a break, seeing as you haven't had one in a while.

Sitting underneath the shade of a nearby tree, you notice a Rabbit come out of a hole a short distance away. It seems interested in you, and cautiously makes its way towards you.

Without warning, it suddenly dives into your inventory and makes off with your Old Pocketwatch.
result_s:
You reflexively make a dive for the Rabbit.

 However, seeing as it is a Rabbit and you are not, it evades your grasp and you end up face-planting in the dirt. When you dust the soil off your face the Rabbit is gone, presumably back in its hole.

Unfortunately, it doesn't seem like you'll be getting your Old Pocketwatch back.

You hastily get up and try to get to the hole before the Rabbit can. Unfortunately, it's too fast. It springs into the hole with your Old Pocketwatch in tow as you watch, helpless.

Unfortunately, it doesn't seem like you'll be getting your Old Pocketwatch back.

You relax as the Rabbit dashes off with your Old Pocketwatch. When it reaches the hole, it pauses to look back at you, and gives an almost imperceptible nod.

It doesn't look like you'll get your Old Pocketwatch back, but it seems it's not unneeded.

event_s:
'Excuse me,' you hear a muffled voice, the source of which is something in your inventory.

You empty out your items to find the voice's origin.

'Excuse me, Master {char[name]}, I must request your assistance for an urgent matter.'

Your Vorpal Sword is, for some reason, appealing to you for help.
result_s:
Thank you ever so much, Master {char[name]}.'

You ask Vorpal Sword what the problem is.

'There is a beast in the Tum-Tum Forest that needs to be put down. While I would do it myself, a sword is useless without someone to wield it,' Vorpal Sword explains.

'I will direct you there, and you will use me to slay it.'

Moved by Vorpal Sword's plea, and under its direction, you begin making your way to the Tum-Tum Forest.
You put Vorpal Sword back into your inventory, ignoring what it has to say. You can always deal with whatever problem it has another time.

After a few hours, you find yourself in the Tum-Tum Forest. Without warning, a giant, scaly, winged monster rises from the shadows underneath the forest canopy, shrieking.

'It's coming!' Vorpal Blade cries.

'Now is the time to strike!'
result_s:
You close your eyes and swing the Vorpal Blade at the creature's head.

With a sharp scream and a crunch, you feel the Vorpal Blade slip from your fingers.

When you open your eyes, the creature's head is lying on the ground, but the body and the Vorpal Blade are nowhere to be seen. Stumped, you decide to take the head, hopeful that the creature did not somehow survive.

(Jabberwocky Head is now in your inventory)

event_s:
You come across a river crossing while you're wandering through the {region[local][name]}.

The river is unusually turbulent, and the bridge is rotting and has partially collapsed.
result_s:
It wouldn't be a smart idea to use a decayed bridge to cross such raging waters.

You decide to keep walking upstream in the hopes that there will be another bridge. After a couple of minutes, you come across one that appears more structurally sound.

You successfully cross over and continue on your way.

You tenuously make your way across the first part of the bridge; you ensure not to step on any members that won't hold your weight, prodding questionable crossbeams with your foot.

Without warning, you hear a resounding 'CRACK', as the beam you placed your weight on gives way, and you fall into the raging river below.

As you lose consciousness, you curse the architect who designed that shoddy excuse for a walkway.

You tenuously make your way across the first part of the bridge; you ensure not to step on any members that won't hold your weight, prodding questionable crossbeams with your foot.

Luckily, you manage to pick the right pieces to place your weight on, and reach the other side unharmed.

No bridge, no matter how poorly designed, will get in your way.

You decide to take the most dangerous route possible when trying to cross a river that is flowing at full force: swim through it.

As you wade into the water, the sheer strength of the water almost knocks you over even at waist height. You remove all doubt from your mind and dive in, promptly losing your foothold and getting carried away.

Your lungs start filling with water and you lose consciousness, trapped in the current.

event_s:
You wake up on a riverbank.

Hacking up water, your lungs feel like they're on fire, but apart from the near-drowning, you're at least alive.

You roll over, exhausted, when you notice a Mysterious Figure crouching in front of you.
result_s:
The Mysterious Figure stands up and walks into the nearby woods.

You aren't in too great a shape, and can't follow them. At least you ended up on the other side of the river.

After lying down for a while, you get up and try to find your way to the nearest town.

You try talking, but your lungs haven't recovered enough yet and all you can do is cough uncontrollably.

The Mysterious Figure is silent. Shortly after, they stand up and disappear into the nearby woods.

At least you ended up on the other side of the river. After lying down for a while, you get up and try to find your way to the nearest town.

You start vomiting up some leftover river water that remained in your lungs.

The Mysterious Figure is silent. Shortly after, they stand up and disappear into the nearby woods.

At least you ended up on the other side of the river. After lying down for a while, you get up and try to find your way to the nearest town.

event_s:
While wandering through the {region[local][name]}, you notice the air around you has grown heavier, and a thick fog has fallen upon you.

You come across the {gen[dungeons][0][name]}. The entrance is covered in an abundance of moss, which leads you to believe that the dungeon has not been explored in quite some time.
result_s:
You enter the dungeon.

This could get interesting.
You decide to find something else to do, and continue exploring {region[local][name]}

event_s:
You walk through a tunnel that opens up into a large underground grotto.

There is a calm stream flowing to your right, which seems to teeter off at the end of the cavern. You also notice a large opening in the wall to the left which leads somewhere else.

When you continue to the opening, you notice that there is a Bucket sitting next to the stream. Nobody else is around.
result_s:
You decide to leave the Bucket where it is.

Your mother always did tell you to be wary of stray Buckets lying on floors of dangerous, monster-infested grottos.

You wind your foot back and unleash a mighty kick unto the Bucket.

Predictably, it goes flying. Unpredictably, the water and fish which you weren't aware were inside also go flying.

The maelstrom of carp and tuna soars through the air and lands in the stream.

You decide to take the Bucket with you on your journey.

Grabbing it by the handle, you also happen to notice that there are a few fish in water inside. They'll be good company.
Peering into the Bucket, you see that it is actually filled with water, as well as several species of fish.

event_s:
You don't know much about fish, so you can't say for sure what types of fish are in the Bucket.

They are varied, and some are very colorful. The water reaches close to the rim of the Bucket, but it looks light enough to carry if you wanted to.

You're not sure what in this dungeon would need a Bucket of Fish™ though.
result_s:
You decide to leave the Bucket of Fish™ where it is.

Your mother always did tell you to be wary of stray Buckets lying on floors of dangerous, monster-infested grottos. Especially so, if they're filled with exotic fish.

You wind your foot back and unleash a mighty kick unto the Bucket of Fish™.

Predictably, it goes flying, along with all of the fish and water inside. Luckily, most land in the river, presumably where they were fished from in the first place.

You decide to take the Bucket™ with you on your journey.

Grabbing it by the handle, you start lugging it through the opening to your right and continuing through the caverns.

Maybe it will come in handy at some point.

event_s:
After moving past the stream and cavern, you go through the opening to your right and continue along the cavernous corridor.

You eventually come across a fork in the passage. To the left is a wooden door, with a fibrous mesh doormat that reads 'WELCOME'. Ahead of you is a short passage, and then solid wall.

It doesn't look like you'll be able to do anything except go left.
result_s: You rap your knuckles on the door and wait patiently for a response.

You reason with yourself that you can always come back to the door and see what's behind it.

With that, you go back the way you came and exit the dungeon.

They also seem to be holding a Bucket of Fish™, which looks to be the same bucket that you walked past in the previous cavern.
result_s:
'Wh-wh-who? Me?' The Squid asks you. You nod.

'I d-d-don't really know him that well, but I deliver f-f-food to him pretty often. He orders Buckets of Fish™ a lot.'

Interesting. You thank the Squid for its time and continue back the way you came, exiting the dungeon.

You avoid eye contact and walk past the Squid.

You continue back and eventually exit the dungeon.

While walking back to where the corridor forked, you notice a timid Squid monster looking into a Bucket, which looks to be the same bucket that you kicked over in the previous cavern.

They look deeply troubled. It seems all they can do is stare at the lack of contents in the bucket.
result_s:
You walk up to the Squid and ask what's wrong.

'The f-f-fish I spent the last h-h-hour gathering are g-g-gone.'

Oops. As the guilt sets in, you offer to go and catch some fish for him.

'If y-y-you can d-do that, I might be ok, but P-P-Penguin might still g-get mad again.'

You promise that you'll get the fish quickly, and head off to the nearby stream.
Too late now.

You probably had something to do with the distress this Squid is currently going through, but if you were worried about consequences, you wouldn't have kicked the Bucket over in the first place.

You pay no mind to the Squid as you walk past and exit the dungeon.

While walking back to where the corridor forked, you notice a timid Squid monster sitting in the corner, obviously distressed.

He quickly glances up at you and his eyes dart to the Bucket of Fish™ you're holding by your side.

'I-i-is t-t-that..?' he stutters, eyes widening in shock.
action_s: Give him the Bucket of Fish™
result_s:
You sprint off with the Bucket of Fish™ by your side, but it's too clunky and heavy to run with. You accidentally drop it, spilling the fish on the ground.

As they flop around, suffocating, you continue running out of the dungeon and back into the open.

You put the Bucket of Fish™ down in front of the Squid and start explaining the situation.

He is hesitant, but as soon as sees that the fish are intact he breaks out into a relieved smile. At least, you think it is; Squid are hard to read.

Content with how the situation turned out, you happily leave the dungeon and continue on your adventure.

You are wandering in a forest in the {region[local][name]} when you come across a person hanging from a tree.

'Hey, how's it hanging?'

He grins, but the air feels somewhat awkward.

'That was a good joke, right? I was here for a while so I thought of it in case someone wandered nearby and could help me down.'

They seem to be trying extra hard to appear untroubled by their current predicament.
result_s:
'HEY, WAIT! WHERE ARE YOU GOING?'

You sadistically yell back that you can't hear him as you run out of the forest.
You ask him how he ended up there.

You notice that the rope runs down from a high branch and is wrapped around a nearby tree.

Pulling out your {char[weapon][full_name]}, you take aim and strike the rope, cleanly splitting it in two. The man drops to the ground onto his head and ends face up, lying on the forest floor. You walk over to see if he's okay.

'WELL, I was just walking through the forest, looking for something I lost a while ago, it's sort of a family heirloom of sorts I guess, but it's not THAT important, it's just important to someone I know, and I heard that there are goblins...?'

'Or something like that - they're in this forest and they steal things from passing travellers! So I walked around for a bit trying to find some goblin tracks or whatever and then I got caught in this friggin' thing! Reminds me of that one scene from Predator, actually.'

You have several questions.
result_s:
'It was my sister who lost the stupid thing. I still dunno what she was doing in the forest but she INSISTS it was important so I guess I have to tag along and do what she says for now. She didn't get attacked by goblins or anything she just dropped it, cause she's an idiot no matter how smart she looks.'

Interesting, but you still have no clue what it actually is.

'Well, it was my sister who lost something in the woods here and she was like 'If you don't go and get the goddamn thing then it'll be REALLY hard to do what I'm planning to do' and I was like, in the middle of something at the time but she insisted on it so here I am being the loving caring selfless brother I am.'

You aren't sure how this is relevant to the question you asked, but at least you know that it was his sister now.

'Yeah, I heard there are goblins in the forest here that target travelling merchants and the like. They're pretty short, so they can hide in bushes and stuff really well apparently. I brought some Anti-goblin spray with me, so they won't be an issue; don't worry about it.'

Anti-goblin spray? Okay then.

'Oh, you haven't seen it? That's too bad.'

'It's a pretty good movie, you should watch it.'

'You owe me a favour for the concussion you gave me with that second-rate rescue! What if I'm going to suffer from permanent brain trauma because you just decided to cut me down without putting down a mattress or something?'

event_s:
After you have finished up for the day, a scruffy man walks up to you, gazing at your impressive Mollusc pile.

'Excuse me, sir,' he begins.

'I couldn't help but notice your magnificent pile of {char[quest][0][full_name]}. Are these for sale, perchance?'
action_s: Give me some time to say goodbye
result_s:
'Thank you, my friend.'

The man is quite happy.

'I do not have much, but please take this gold as compensation for these wonderfully acquired Molluscs.'

He hands you the money and bids you farewell.

'Ah, I understand completely.'

This scruffy man is quite empathetic to your emotional plight.

He leaves you for now, but he will return when you have had enough time to say goodbye to your precious Molluscs.

'I am an Examiner,' he tells you,

'I examine things for money, and let you know what they really are. My service only requires 5 gold. What would you like me to examine?'

He seems to be holding a scroll of some kind.

You wonder how you were ever so blind as you walk away with your {gen[items][0][full_name]}.
